intro: Parsonsia subalpina, commonly known as the alpine flame vine, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, with a glossy green surface. Parsonsia subalpina thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions.
